newsitem.title: USA: Toyota bracing for shortages from fire - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Toyota bracing for shortages from fire - WSJ.

text.p: Toyota Motor Corp says it is bracing for "severe" short-term shortages of certain models bound for export to the United States, the Wall Street Journal said Thursday.
The company believes its 20 assembly plants will still resume operations Friday, but said it will take time to make up for lost production caused by a fire at a supplier's factory, the paper said.
"We are in a severe short-supply situation," an executive in Toyota's overseas division told the paper.
A Toyota spokeswoman told the paper the reduction in shipments from Japan would be 7,000 units but said it would have a minimal impact on sales.

Earlier today a private research body in Japan estimated that Saturday's fire at the Aisin Seiki Co Ltd brake parts plant could cost the No. 1 Japanese auto maker more than 40 billion yen on an operating profit basis.
